title: The Art Of Final Fantasy 3-Book Box Set Is 60% Off At Amazon For Black Friday
description: The Sky: The Art of Final Fantasy Box Set $77.64 (was $200) Get deal at Amazon Final Fantasy fans can save big on a beautiful three-book box set that celebrates the art of legendary designer and illustrator Yoshitaka Amano. Normally $200, The Sky: The Art of Final Fantasy Box Set is on sale for only $77.64 in Amazon's Black Friday sale. This is a new all-time low for The Sky, and Amazon has limited quantities available during the promotion. Along with three hardcover books featuring artwork for the original Final Fantasy through Final Fantasy X, the set comes with a few bonus booklets and inserts as well as a gorgeous display box. The Sky: The Art of Final Fantasy 3-Book Box Set $77.64 ($200) The Sky: The Art of Final Fantasy Box Set Get deal at Amazon The Sky: The Art of Final Fantasy was originally published in limited quantities in 2013. The box set on Amazon is the second edition, which Dark Horse published in November 2023. Together, the three hardcover books include 824 pages of full-color character and world art created by Amano during the development of Final Fantasy (1987) through Final Fantasy X (2001). Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: God Of War 20th Anniversary Retrospective Deluxe Box Set Is Over 50% Off
description: God of War: 20th Anniversary Retrospective Box Set $55 (was $100) | Black Friday Deal See at Amazon God of War: 20th Anniversary Retrospective Deluxe Box Set $93.54 (was $200) | Black Friday Deal See at Amazon God of War fans can get the new 20th Anniversary Retrospective Box Set for all-time low prices thanks to Amazon's Black Friday Lightning Deals. title: How To Get A Free Marvel Rivals Skin During The First Anniversary Event
description: Marvel Rivals is rapidly approaching its one year anniversary in early December, but the in-game event has already kicked off. The Anniversary event is putting up tons of free and paid rewards for you to grab, including a free Legendary Jeff the Land Shark skin. There are also tons of free Units up for grabs, with a catch. How to get the Jeff the Land Shark Business Shark skin The free Business Shark skin for Jeff comes in a limited-time reward event called Jeff's Break Time. As you earn match XP, you'll get coins to redeem items inside a virtual vending machine. There are free coins and paid coins, each unlocking items from different parts of the vending machine. Jeff's skin is in the free section, as are a new element to Rivals skins: customizable parts. Earning match XP will earn you coins, which can redeem items in the vending machine.Jeff's Break Time is a 20-day event, but like all event passes, if you purchase the premium version it becomes permanently available to you, allowing you to earn the rewards at your own pace. The premium version costs 990 Lattice ($10), and includes the Dad-tastic Reed Mister Fantastic and Disappearing Dessert Invisible Woman skins, as well. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Battlefield 6 For PS5 And Xbox Gets 50% Discount For Black Friday
description: Battlefield 6 $35 (was $70) See at Amazon Battlefield 6 is on sale for a massive discount for PS5 and Xbox Series X for Black Friday. Amazon is offering a 50% discount on the physical edition, dropping the price from $70 to $35 on both platforms. Battlefield 6 launched October 10, so a 50% discount this soon, especially for a game that was already selling well, is surprising. Amazon has already sold out of this deal at least once, so snag a copy of the new multiplayer FPS while you can. Battlefield 6 $35 (was $70) The Battlefield 6 standard edition includes the base game on your platform of choice. While the game is packed with tons of single-player and multiplayer content, there's also the Battlefield 6 Season Pass available as a separate in-game purchase for those who want to add a bit more personality to their online persona. See at Amazon After a misstep with Battlefield 2042, DICE seems to be back on track with Battlefield 6. Our Battlefield 6 review gave it a 7/10, shouting out its impressive gunplay and new features like crouch sprinting and dragging downed enemies that add a new twist to the usual Battlefield formula. Battlefield 6 features both a single-player campaign and online multiplayer, but it's the latter that's earning the most praise. "Battlefield 6 is a return to form, even if it doesn't reach the same highs as the series at its peak," wrote Richard Wakeling. "The campaign is as lackluster as expected, and the multiplayer maps are only ever decent at best, but there's still a chaotic and super-satisfying shooter here that offers multiplayer thrills unlike any other. Even if you're not racking up kills by the dozens, you're still rewarded for contributing in other ways, and you're never too far away from being in the middle of a histrionic Battlefield moment." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Riftbound Exclusive Champion Unit Reveal And What's Next For The Hit League Of Legends Spin-Off
description: Riftbound, the League of Legends trading card game, launched in late October to an incredible fan reaction. Packs, themed decks, and an all-in-one tutorial game called Proving Grounds quickly sold out, and the competitive scene is starting to come into its own with tournaments popping up all over the country. PAX Unplugged served as the launching pad for the game's second set, Spiritforged, which will launch in early 2026. New cards, mechanics, and Champions were debuted during an hour-long panel led by Dave Guskin, the lead designer for Riftbound at Riot Games, and previews of new cards have popped up around the internet since then. We sat down with Dave Guskin at PAX Unplugged to learn more about internal reactions to Riftbound's release, as well as what the team has planned for Spiritforged and beyond. We also have an exclusive card from Spiritforged to reveal, with Guskin giving his thoughts on how this new Champion can best be used in battle. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: CRKD's Gibson Les Paul Guitar Controllers Get Black Friday Discount
description: CRKD Gibson Les Paul Guitar Controller - Encore Edition $97.49 (was $115) See at Amazon CRKD Gibson Les Paul Guitar Controller - Pro Edition $106.19 (was $125) See at Amazon Video game instruments are fashionable once again, thanks in part to Fortnite Festival and CRKD's officially licensed Gibson Les Paul Guitar Controllers. If you've been looking to get one for yourself, these are on sale for Black Friday, and currently, you can grab the eye-catching Blueberry Burst Pro and Black Tribal models at a low price. Switch owners can also rock out with a Linkin Park-themed take on the CRKD Neo S, a five-button fret attachment for Fortnite's Guitar Hero-inspired game mode that comes equipped with pro-style features. Amazon is selling both the Xbox and multi-platform versions of CRKD's guitar controllers, which might sound confusing. The multiplatform guitars are compatible specifically with PC, Nintendo Switch, and Switch 2, and Android in both wired and wireless modes, while the Xbox-licensed version of this guitar controller supports Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PC, and Android. To make things easier, we've outlined all the discounted CRKD controllers below and have listed which platforms they support. CRKD Gibson Les Paul Guitar Controller - Encore Edition $97.49 (was $115) The Black Tribal model features a simple yet elegant body design, focusing on a user experience very similar to the classic Guitar Hero and Rock Band guitars of yesteryear. The strum bar uses a Hall Effect sensor, the frets have rubber membranes, and you'll find traditional inputs like integrated analog sticks, a D-pad on the headstock, and an eight-button navigation hub. This controller also has a modular design, allowing you to swap out the neck for one with mechanical frets installed or up to five additional solo frets. Black Tribal (multiplatform) -- $97.49 ($115) Black Tribal (Xbox) -- $115 ($125) See at Amazon CRKD Gibson Les Paul Guitar Controller - Pro Edition $106.19 (was $125) The Pro model of the Gibson Les Paul guitar costs a bit more, but it offers much more than the standard model. You'll get all of the core features listed above, as well as a Hall Effect strum bar with built-in haptic feedback. customizable sensitivity, and multiple actuation points. The fret buttons on the Pro models also utilize mechanical switches to provide faster movements and input recognition, and there's RGB lighting on the neck. The emphasis on mechanical buttons is to provide better controller feedback, greater precision when playing, and a longer shelf-life for regular rhythm game fans. Blueberry Burst Pro (multiplatform) -- $106.19 ($125) Blueberry Burst Pro (Xbox) -- $125 ($135) See at Amazon CRKD Neo S Wireless Controller - Linkin Park Edition $45 (was $60) CRKD Neo S Controller: Linkin Park EditionThe Linkin Park-themed Neo S Wireless Controller from CRKD is a solid option for anyone looking for a compact way to play rhythm games. Borrowing several design elements from the band's new album, From Zero, the controller is on sale for $45 (was $60) and features high-quality construction. It can wirelessly pair to a Switch 1 console, PC, and mobile devices, and it has Hall Effect sticks and triggers, remappable back buttons, swappable stick caps, and adjustable settings. See at Amazon CRKD isn't the only third-party manufacturer with a Fortnite- and Rock Band-compatible guitar controller. PDP also offers the Riffmaster, which happens to also be on sale during Black Friday to $110 (was $150) at Amazon. Yu can pick one up for PS5, Xbox Series X|S, orPC. The Riffmaster has a strumming paddle and fret buttons on its neck, an analog stick, shoulder strap, and 3.5mm headphone jack. While it is limited in hardware compatibility, it connects to its chosen console seamlessly and offers up to 36 hours of battery life. The Xbox version also works on PC, while the PS5 version will require you to download some third-party drivers. For even more gaming deals, check out GameSpot's Black Friday 2025 hub. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Build A Library Of Video Game Books With These Black Friday Deals
description: If you're looking for ways to learn more about the in-game worlds and real-world development history of your favorite video games, then you'll want to check out Amazon's Black Friday sale, which has discounts on dozens of video game art books, cookbooks, and more. Better yet, many are also eligible for the site's B2G1 Free promotion on books, Blu-rays, and more, which means you can score even bigger discounts by grabbing multiple books. To get the B2G1 Free offer, select three eligible items, and the price of the cheapest item in your cart will be subtracted from your order total. See All Video Game Books Deals At Amazon Many video game publishers have released books that show how the visuals of various video games were formed, and Amazon has several of them on sale. The art book for Assassin's Creed: Shadows shows just how Ubisoft brought feudal Japan to life for this game, The Art and Making of Arcane is a vibrant look behind the scenes of the critically acclaimed League of Legends animated series, and the Sonic the Hedgehog Encyclo-Speedia covers decades of games featuring the Sega Icon. JRPG games have some of the best art teams around, and you can pick up books dedicated to Bravely Default II and Octopath Traveler. We'd also recommend the God of War: 20th Anniversary Retrospective for a deluxe look at the popular action franchise, told through exclusive interviews with the creative teams behind the games. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Lego Batman Animated Series Batmobile Drops To Best Price Ever For Black Friday
description: Lego DC Batman: The Animated Series Batmobile (435 Pieces) $38.49 (was $60) | Retiring Soon See at Amazon Batman: The Complete Animated Series on Blu-ray $28.49 (was $80) See at Amazon Batman fans who grew up watching the awesome early '90s animated series will want to check out Amazon's Black Friday deal on the Lego Batmobile from the show. The 435-piece Batman: The Animated Series Batmobile is on sale for only $38.49 (was $60). This deal is especially notable because Lego is retiring this Batman building set soon. And if you'd like the perfect background noise while piecing together the Batmobile, the Blu-ray box set collecting all 85 episodes is on sale for only $28.49 for Black Friday. Lego DC Batman: The Animated Series Batmobile (435 Pieces) $38.49 (was $60) | Retiring Soon Lego released this particular Batmobile last June alongside a few other sets, including the Batman Mech Armor that's also featured in Amazon's Black Friday Lego sale. The set is technically called Batman with the Batmobile vs. Harley Quinn and Mr. Freeze, so it won't surprise you that it comes with those three characters as minifigures. Harley Quinn wields a comically large hammer, while Mr. Freeze has a functional stud launcher. The Batman minifigure is based on his look in the show and has a molded cape. The Batmobile is over 11 inches long and has removable stud launchers, a seat for one minifigure that is accessed by lifting the cockpit hatch. A detachable exhaust flame element twirls when the wheels spin. It has everything that makes a Batmobile Lego model a playset for young Caped Crusader fans--it's recommended for builders ages 8 and up--but it doubles as a nice display piece thanks to the included 360-degree rotatable stand and information placard that's more commonly seen with Lego models designed for adults. See at Amazon Batman: The Complete Animated Series on Blu-ray $28.49 (was $80) Batman: The Complete Animated Series actually includes even more than just the 85-episode series that ran from 1992-1995. It also comes with all 24 episodes of The New Adventures of Batman, Batman: Mask of the Phantasm, and Batman and Mr. Freeze. Fans should also check out the Blu-ray box set deals for three other animated series: Batman Beyond (1999), The Batman (2004), and the classic Adventures of Batman (1968). Batman: The Complete Animated Series (Blu-ray) -- $28.49 ($80) Batman Beyond: The Complete Series (Blu-ray) -- $19 ($55) The Batman: The Complete Series (2004-2008) (Blu-ray) -- $29.49 ($70) The Adventures of Batman: The Complete Collection (Blu-ray) -- $11 ($30) See at Amazon Amazon Black Friday Sale: Best Lego Deals (Nov. 28) Lego Star Wars: Battle Droid with STAP (1,088 pieces) -- $90 ($140) Lego Star Wars: Tantive IV (654 pieces) -- $40 ($80) Lego Star Wars: Boarding the Tantive IV (502 pieces) -- $38.49 ($55) Lego Icons Pac-Man Arcade (2,651 pieces) -- $189 ($270) Lego Technic & Speed Champions McLaren Pack (2 Sets, 697 pieces) -- $54 ($77) Lego DC Batman Animated Series Batmobile (435 pieces) -- $38.49 ($60) Lego DC Batman Mech Armor (140 pieces) -- $12 ($15) Lego Disney Cruella De Vil's Car (378 pieces) -- $35 ($50) Lego Icons: Jazz Club (2,899 pieces) -- $160 ($230) Lego City Robot World Roller Coaster (986 pieces) -- $70 ($100) Lego City Yellow Delivery Truck (1,061 pieces) -- $70 ($100) Lego City Yellow Mobile Construction Crane (1,116 pieces) -- $77 ($110) Lego Technic: NASA Apollo Lunar Roving Vehicle (1,913 pieces) -- $154 ($220) Lego Technic: NASA Mars Rover Perseverance (1,132 pieces) -- $70 ($100) Lego Classic: Vibrant Creative Brick Box (850 pieces) -- $42 ($60) Lego Duplo Classic: Cars and Trucks Brick Box (80 pieces) -- $35 ($50) Black Friday Lego Deals at Amazon Check out the deals before they're gone. title: Save $50 On Lego's 1,088-piece Star Wars Battle Droid Model For Black Friday
description: Lego Star Wars Battle Droid with STAP (1,088 pieces) $90 (was $140) See at Amazon Black Friday Lego Deals at Amazon Check out the deals before they're gone. See at Amazon Star Wars fans can save on one of this year's 1,000+ piece Lego sets for Black Friday. As part of Amazon's Black Friday Lego sale, the the 1,088-piece Battle Droid with STAP, is discounted to only $90 (was $140) while supplies last. The $50 discount is the best deal on this cool Battle Droid since its debut in July. Up until now, the lowest price had been $130. Star Wars Lego deals can sell out fast--especially ones that haven't received major discounts before. Lego Star Wars Battle Droid with STAP (1,088 pieces) $90 (was $140) A recreation of the Battle Droids introduced in Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace, this Lego set is a replica of the cannon fodder trooper and the STAP (Single Trooper Aeriel Platform) speeder. The fully assembled build features several screen-accurate details, movable limbs, and a blaster that can be held in its hands or attached to its back. For display options, there's a stand you can place the droid and the STAP on, and it comes with an information placard and a Battle Droid minifigure riding its very own tiny STAP. The Battle Droid with STAP measures 11.5 x 5.5 x 15 inches. See at Amazon Amazon's Black Friday Lego sale includes a few other notable Star Wars deals. The 654-piece model of Princess Leia's Tantive IV transport vessel is 50% off, dropping the price to only $40 (was $80). You can also get the 502-piece Boarding the Tantive IV scene diorama for $38.49 (was $55). The scene comes with seven Lego minifigures and recreates Darth Vader's first appearance in Episode IV: A New Hope. Darth Vader fans can also get the 630-piece Executor Super Star Destroyer for $40 (was $70) in Walmart's Black Friday Lego sale. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Like Satisfactory And Anime Girls? Try This Game
description: At the beginning of 2025, Hypergryph shared the first closed beta test for Arknights: Endfield, the free-to-play action-RPG spin-off from the Arknights franchise. Now, the second beta test has begun, and it appears to be a considerable upgrade over the game's previous state. This work-in-progress build has "50-60 hours worth of polished content,"a rebuilt storyline, fresh cutscenes and more according to Hypergryph. The combat has also been refined and there's a new region, Wuling, that's now ripe for exploration. The game casts players as the Endministrator, the leader of Endfield Industries who has no memory of the past. As the Endmin reclaims their life, they fight alongside companions and attempt to explore and exploit the wild planet Talos-II. Much like Satisfactory, players can extract resources from the planet and build factories to fully utilize the materials they have at hand. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Trump says U.S. to 'permanently pause migration from all Third World Countries’ after DC shooting
description: The president said he would also terminate "millions" of admissions under his predecessor Joe Biden and remove "anyone who is not a net asset" to the U.S.

title: Bitcoin and S&P 500 Year-End Bull Run Loading? Vol Metrics Say Yes
description: Implied volatility indices tied to bitcoin and the S&P 500 have erased the recent spike, offering bullish price signals.

title: SEC investigates Jefferies over First Brands collapse, report says
description: The FT said the SEC is looking into whether Jefferies gave investors enough information on their exposure to the failed auto business.

title: With Trump's tax bill set to dent giving by the wealthy, can middle-class donors make up the difference?
description: Next year, some 140 million Americans will get a new tax break on donations. Experts warn it's unclear whether they will use it.
